metadata.title: CVE-2017-3319 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: X Plugin). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.16 andearlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attackerwith network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized readaccess to a subset of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS v3.0 Base Score3.1 (Confidentiality impacts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.17-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
